Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw two plants, one receiving water and light, and one without water.
The student can draw another two plants, one receiving light and water, and one placed in the dark.
The student can illustrate what happens to a plant when it doesn’t get water (e.g., wilting, drying).
The student can illustrate what happens to a plant when it doesn’t get light (e.g., not growing, turning yellow).
The student can use their drawings to show that plants need both water and light to live and grow.
